intro: Serjania crenata, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or red mangaba, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Serjania, which includes several species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its fruits are woody, spherical drupes that turn red when mature. Serjania crenata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types.
